summary: SEN. BERNIE SANDERS claims that his campaign is about defeating Secretary Clinton on the real issues, such as breaking up Wall Street banks, raising the minimum wage to $15 an hour, and voting against the War in Iraq. This claim was made during the Sanders MeetThePress event on May 29th, 2016.

SEN. BERNIE SANDERS claims that the media and the candidates should focus on the decline of the middle class and income inequality, as these issues are more important to the American people than other topics being discussed. He emphasizes that his campaign is centered around addressing these fundamental problems. This claim was made during a Meet the Press interview on May 29th, 2016.

SEN. BERNIE SANDERS claims that his campaign is focused on the future of the American middle class and addressing their fundamental problems, rather than being concerned with the issue of Hillary Clinton's emails. He also criticizes The New York Times for being dismissive and negative towards his campaign. Additionally, he states that his main goal is to defeat Secretary Clinton on the real issues, such as breaking up the Wall Street banks.
